Plot per variable summary in SuSiE CSs

Source: R/susie_utils.R
susie_plot.Rd

Plot per variable summary in SuSiE CSs

susie_plot(model, y, add_bar = FALSE, pos = NULL, b = NULL,
  max_cs = 400, add_legend = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

model

a susie fit, the output of `susieR::susie()`. It has to contain `z`, `PIP` and optionally `sets`. It is also possible to take in a vector of z-score or PIP, in order to plot data from other software program.
y

a string indicating what to plot: z (for z-score), PIP, log10PIP or a random label to plot input data as is.
add_bar

add horizontal bar to signals in credible interval.
pos

coordinates of variables to plot, default to all variables
b

for simulated data, specify b = true effects (highlights in red).
max_cs

the biggest CS to display, based on purity (set max_cs in between 0 and 1) or size (>1).
add_legend

if TRUE, add a legend to annotate the size and purity of each CS discovered.

Contents

  • Arguments

Developed by Gao Wang, Peter Carbonetto, Yuxin Zou, Kaiqian Zhang, Matthew Stephens.
